meanings.definition: A newspaper having pages half the size of a standard newspaper, typically popular in style and dominated by headlines, photographs, and sensational stories.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading tabloids for the exciting stories and big headlines.
meanings.sent2: The tabloids at the store always have eye-catching photos on the front page.
meanings.sent3: The tabloids made me laugh with their exaggerated stories about aliens.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a sea of tabloids, each one screaming for attention.
meanings.sent5: The tabloids painted a vivid picture of the celebrity's scandalous life.

meanings.definition: A type of paper size, typically measuring 17 by 22 inches.
meanings.sent1: The printer only had tabloids in stock, so I had to adjust my document size.
meanings.sent2: The tabloids were perfect for printing flyers due to their compact size.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally used tabloids for my essay, and it turned out to be a tiny booklet.
meanings.sent4: The tabloids were like miniature canvases waiting to be filled with art.
meanings.sent5: The tabloids stood out among the larger papers, making them easy to find.
